sanskrit_verse:
जातो निषादात्शूद्रायां जात्या भवति पुक्कसः ।
शूद्राज्जातो निषाद्यां तु स वै कुक्कुटकः स्मृतः ॥ १०.१८॥
transliteration:
jāto niṣādāt śūdrāyāṁ jātyā bhavati pukkasaḥ |
śūdrāj jāto niṣādyāṁ tu sa vai kukkuṭakaḥ smṛtaḥ || 10.18 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One born of a Niṣāda father and a Śūdra mother by birth becomes a Pukkasa; one born of a Śūdra father and a Niṣāda mother becomes a Kukkuṭaka.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from Consciousness alignment, not lineage alone
Causation is determined through sequential manifestation (Anupūrvaśaḥ) of birth-based roles
Capacity-based responsibility flows from societal integration, not inherited status
Restoration logic emphasizes reintegration within one's functional Varna-dharma
Consciousness alignment requires recognition and acceptance of one's natural role
executable_legal_axioms: IF parent_1 = Niṣāda AND parent_2 = Śūdra THEN offspring.class = Pukkasa
IF parent_1 = Śūdra AND parent_2 = Niṣāda THEN offspring.class = Kukkuṭaka
FOR EACH individual : classification ≠ punitive designation BUT functional assignment FOR social harmony
WHEN misidentification occurs : initiate realignment protocol TO restore dharma-appropriate function
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that classification based on birth is not punitive but functional. The court must ensure that such classifications are applied with full awareness of their restorative intent and without discrimination. Legal thresholds must recognize varna as dynamic when aligned with consciousness evolution.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causal sequence determines role, not judgment or stigma. Sequential manifestation aligns with Dharma order. Responsibility arises from acceptance of role, not imposition. Thus, there is no punitive element—only alignment with inherent capacity.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to affirm individual's rightful place in societal structure
Engage integrity reintegration through community acknowledgment of role
Support capacity restoration via skill development aligned with assigned function
Facilitate consciousness alignment through ritual and dharmic education
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. This verse upholds Dharma through precise classification rooted in causality, ensuring restoration, reintegration, and consciousness alignment. There is no punishment—only alignment with Reality.
